result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakesha S Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lakesha S Willis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Angela D. Cunningham appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  cab
  On state's motion, court orders charge AMENDED to a County Ordinance #63.01, Disorderly Conduct to which defendant plead guilty.  Defendant found guilty of amended charge.  Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $100.00 including costs to be paid by 09/12/2016 or entry of a civil judgement.

Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a review hearing.
Report received and filed.
The defendant is doing well.
The court ordered the case calendared for one additional review hearing in Branch 36.
  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The court is not in session on the previously calendared date of 02/05/2016.  Case recalendared for another review hearing on 02/03/2016 at 01:30 p.m.
cab

Attorney Hazel Jean Washington in court.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
As to count 1:
  Filed, signed Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  The court reviewed the Agreement with the defendant.  
The defendant was advised of his/her constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction for a period of 9 months.
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and found it to be in the best interest of the parties and the general public.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant  to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Case adjourned to Branch 36 for a review hearing.
  Review hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
District attorney has failed to contact the victim regarding the deferred prosecution agreement and they are asking for another plea hearing.
Case adjourned for another plea hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are in court for a pretrial date.
Case adjourned for a plea hearing in Branch 36.
  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Hazel Jean Washington.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defense Counsel requests an adjourend Pretrial Confernece. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

07/07/2015

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with S.J.W. DOB 3/13/72.

Defendant Lakesha S Willis in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Lakesha S Willis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
